toolTip:
• Grade 1 - Any deviation from the normal postoperative course without the need for pharmacological treatment or surgical, endoscopic and radiological interventions
  • Grade 2 - Requiring pharmacological treatment with drugs other than such allowed for Grade 1
  • Grade 3a - Requiring surgical, endoscopic or radiological intervention, not under general anaesthesia
  • Grade 3b - Requiring surgical, endoscopic or radiological Intervention under general anaesthesia
  • Grade 4a - Life-threatening single organ dysfunction (including dialysis) requiring Intermediate Care (e.g. Acute Care Ward, HDU)/Intensive Care unit management.
    CNS complications include brain haemorrhage, ischaemic stroke, subarachnoidal bleeding, but exclude transient ischaemic attacks
  • Grade 4b - Life-threatening Multi-organ dysfunction (including dialysis) requiring Intermediate Care (e.g. Acute Care Ward, HDU)/Intensive Care unit management.
    CNS complications include brain haemorrhage, ischaemic stroke, subarachnoidal bleeding, but exclude transient ischaemic attacks
  • Grade 5 - Death of patient
